item.title: Israel passes law to cap bankers' salaries
item.description:
Israel passes law to cap bankers' salaries

Israel has introduced one of the world's toughest curbs on bank executives' salaries in an effort to narrow a big pay gap between bosses and workers. The legislation was pushed through by the finance minister, Moshe Kahlon, who, before last year's parliamentary elections, ran on a platform of lowering the cost of living and reforming Israel's banks.

item.title: Tell Congress: It's Time to Move FASTR
item.description:
Tell Congress: It's Time to Move FASTR

Publicly Funded Research Should Be Publicly Available When you pay for federally funded research, you should be allowed to read it. That's the simple premise of the Fair Access to Science and Technology Research Act ( S.779, H.R.1477), which was just passed out of a major Senate committee.

item.title: There is no "my" in open source
item.description:
There is no "my" in open source

If you use Node, you've probably been following this week's story between Azer Ko√ßulu, Kik and npm. A brief rundown: Azer made an npm module called "kik", which shares its name with a company. Kik asked him to rename the module, and Azer refused, so npm intervened and reassigned it to Kik.
